bill_title: to change the number of days of notice that must be given to the county commissioners for special sessions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to change the number of days of notice that must be given to the county commissioners for special sessions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 7-8-14 be amended to read as follows: 7-8-14. The board of county commissioners shall meet and hold sessions for the transaction of business at the courthouse or at the usual place of holding court on the first Tuesdays in January, April, July, and October of each year, and may adjourn from time to time; and the county auditor or the chairman of the board of county commissioners shall have power to may call special sessions when if the interests of the county demand it upon by giving three days' notice of such the special session by mailing a copy of such the notice to each of the county commissioners at their several post office addresses or by giving such one day notice to each commissioner by telephone. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to change the number of days of notice that must be given to the county commissioners for special sessions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 7-8-14 be amended to read as follows: 7-8-14. The board of county commissioners shall meet and hold sessions for the transaction of business at the courthouse or at the usual place of holding court on the first Tuesdays in January, April, July, and October of each year, and may adjourn from time to time; and the county auditor or the chairman of the board of county commissioners shall have power to may call special sessions when if the interests of the county demand it upon by giving three days' notice of such the special session by mailing a copy of such the notice to each of the county commissioners at their several post office addresses or by giving such one day notice to each commissioner by telephone. BILL HISTORY 1/20/98 First read in Senate and referred to Local Government. S.J. 120 1/26/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/26/98 Local Government Do Pass, Passed, AYES 6, NAYS 1. S.J. 189 1/27/98 Senate Do Pass, Passed, AYES 24, NAYS 11. S.J. 220 1/28/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 291 2/12/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/12/98 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 598 2/12/98 Local Government Place on Consent Calendar.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to change the number of days of notice that must be given to the county commissioners for special sessions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 7-8-14 be amended to read as follows: 7-8-14. The board of county commissioners shall meet and hold sessions for the transaction of business at the courthouse or at the usual place of holding court on the first Tuesdays in January, April, July, and October of each year, and may adjourn from time to time ; and the . The county auditor or the chairman of the board of county commissioners shall have power to may call special sessions when if the interests of the county demand it upon by giving three days' notice of such the special session by mailing a copy of such the notice to each of the county commissioners at their several post office addresses or by giving such notice to each commissioner by telephone designated post office addresses. In case of an emergency, a special session may be called by giving one day's notice to each commissioner by telephone. An emergency for the purpose of this section is an unforeseen occurrence or combination of circumstances that calls for immediate action or remedy .
